title: Coherent or Not? Stressing a Neural Language Model for Discourse Coherence in Multiple Languages
authors:
Brunato, Dominique  and
Dell{'}Orletta, Felice  and
Dini, Irene  and
Ravelli, Andrea Amelio
venue: Findings of the Association for Computational Linguistics: ACL 2023
abstract: In this study, we investigate the capability of a Neural Language Model (NLM) to distinguish between coherent and incoherent text, where the latter has been artificially created to gradually undermine local coherence within text. While previous research on coherence assessment using NLMs has primarily focused on English, we extend our investigation to multiple languages. We employ a consistent evaluation framework to compare the performance of monolingual and multilingual models in both in-domain and out-domain settings. Additionally, we explore the modelâ€™s performance in a cross-language scenario.
